returns._0: surveyId The id of the survey created.

hasVoted(uint256,address).details: Notice that it doesn't matter whether the entry is considered valid or not.

returns._0: hasVoted Returns true if the user has submitted an entry to a survey.

revealResults(uint256).custom:requirements: - The survey should be finished, meaning we reach the end of the submission time.
revealResults(uint256).details: When revealing the result of the survey, we need to ensure that we have reach the threshold number of participants, to avoid any leak in the vote. When the threshold is reached, we can rely on the Zama Gateway mechanism to decypher the vote.

submitEntry(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[],by.custom:requirements: - User has not already voted - The survey should still be active. - The input metadata lenght should match the survey one.

params.inputProof: Cryptographic proof verifying the validity of the encrypted inputs.

submitWhitelistedEntry(uint256,bytes32,b.custom:requirements: - User should be whitelisted and the merkle proof should be validated. - User has not already voted - The survey should still be active. - The input metadata lenght should match the survey one.

params.inputProof: Cryptographic proof verifying the validity of the encrypted inputs.
params.whitelistProof: Merkle proof path to validate to confirm whitelisted user.

surveyData(uint256).details: It represents the current survey state.

surveyParams(uint256).details: This represents the parameter of the survey defined by the organizer.

hasVoted(uint256,address).notice: Indicates if a user has submitted an entry for a given survey.

submitEntry(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[],by.notice: Submit a new entry for a polling/benchmark survey.

submitWhitelistedEntry(uint256,bytes32,b.notice: Submit a new entry for a whitelisted polling/benchmark survey.
